subject: Re: [junit] Database Select query checks!! newbie
msgSnippet: From: J. B. Rainsberger  ... ResultSet. exactly. ... simulate the ... DECIMAL ... to code ... against real ... It shouldn t be so
messageBody:
From: "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
> Not quite. The REAL stuff to test is creating a News object from a
ResultSet.

exactly.

> You could use a MockResultSet for that, but then you'd need to
simulate the
> database sending you back data in ways you didn't expect. For example,
DECIMAL
> is BigDecimal under Oracle and Double under DB2. Unless you're willing
to code
> that knowledge into your MockResultSet, you're better off testing
against real
> ResultSet objects coming from your trusty JDBC driver.

It shouldn't be so hard to knock up one or more MockResultSets, you only
need to implement just the functionality you need, and you're allowed
more than one implementation if that's simpler. More to the point, isn't
that just the sort of knowledge you _should_ code into your unit tests
so that when you change something you can find the DB2-specific bugs (or
whatever). One of the side effects (which my be good or bad) of writing
mocks is that it forces you to really understand what your external
frameworks do.

Steve
